radiographic_examinations.findings: No air-space disease or cardiac enlargement; a small, ill-defined fullness was observed along the right mediastinum, possibly attributable to the prominence of the great vessels.
Systolic ejection fraction was 52%; inferolateral and inferior hypokinesis; both ventricles appeared unusually thickened and edematous; a small pericardial effusion was seen.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: A repeat echocardiogram showed deterioration, with severe, global systolic dysfunction of the left ventricle and an ejection fraction of 24%; later showed recovery of left ventricular systolic function, with no signs of myocardial edema or hypokinesis.

radiographic_examinations.findings: A large pericardial effusion was identified.
